ac35d277c21ee8c2966c776e7e4221d5 (02:06): AqD: Stop waiting, start helping!

f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (02:16): sometimes I look at code and wonder how the hell the end user ever thought it bloody worked in the first place... when it most obviously just does not.... =/
ac35d277c21ee8c2966c776e7e4221d5 (02:18): if you tell them it works, they'll believe you
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:20): yay i got email hosted by google now :P
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:22): i need some mods of a script (simple one) for meh blog
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:23): and everyone i ask for help wants money
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:23): what exactly do you need done...?
f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (02:23): where been asking?  and what you want doing?
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:24): what i have is a wordpress blog and i use a cute plugin for highlighting code -> take a look here -> http://i-nz.net/2006/07/05/gaim-sharp-naaah/
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:25): the code of the plugin is ...
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:25): the animal in that pic above
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:25): i-nZ: check out GeSHi for highlighting
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:26): and generates the nice thing you see on the post
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:26): but i wanted to have one more feature
f674c87f876fa6506266680b044b928c (02:26): hmm it auto-hilights code inside a pre block?
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:27): and then have a "Hide Code/Show Code"
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:27): so if visible=true it will default to Hide Code and so on
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:27): unless you have something custom to parse that pre tag...
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:28): because a client won't know what to do with that
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:28): pre just means it's been formatted and to display literal
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:28): the content of the post is passed to this function when rendering
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:29): seem easy to do what i want
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:29): it's just i don't have the bloody idea how to do it in php
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:30): i really suck in web deving lol
c5baaaf6252b7951723a12cc30d43f95 (02:40): What is it you are trying to do in PHP?
c5baaaf6252b7951723a12cc30d43f95 (02:42): yeh, just having a look
839bc7ed2771b6f3310f45a914979e59 (02:44): But if it is false. It will minimize it?
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:45): and then the state of the link will change to "Show Code"
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:45): something like the "Show Plain Text/Show Styled Code"
839bc7ed2771b6f3310f45a914979e59 (02:46): that is simple, all you have to do is add javascript
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:46): but then it would be a good idea to have a caption for the code snippet instead of "CSharp" in front
839bc7ed2771b6f3310f45a914979e59 (02:46): within a simple onclick event you can change the style of that below div to be display:none
